summary:

Now there's one more: Bear Blog...
title: Bear Blog Tips & Tricks Collection

summary: HashiCorp is hiring in India – hear the leader of our Bengaluru co-working space talk about our values and find out what a typical day at the co-working space looks like
title: What it’s like to work at HashiCorp in Bengaluru

summary: Most accomplished cybercriminals go out of their way to separate their real names from their hacker handles.  But among certain old-school Russian hackers it is not uncommon to find major players who have done little to prevent people from figuring out who they are in real life.  A case study in this phenomenon is "x999xx," the nickname chosen by a venerated Russian hacker who specializes in providing the initial network access to various ransomware groups
title: The Not-So-Secret Network Access Broker x999xx

summary:
“Not everything has to be for sale. ”
Pretty obvious, right.  But it’s also very easy to forget, especially when it comes to our creative endeavors...
title: Re: Not everything has to be for sale

title: Birthdays

summary: Yesterday, I found out that I have been celebrating the wrong day for a quarter of a century
title: On Celebrating the Wrong Day For 25 years

summary:
It’s a serious one:
The vulnerability, which is a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH’s server (sshd), allows unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) as root on glibc-based Linux systems; that presents a significant security risk.  This race condition affects sshd in its default configuration. 
[…]
This vulnerability, if exploited, could lead to full system compromise where an attacker can execute arbitrary code with the highest privileges, resulting in a complete system takeover, installation of malware, data manipulation, and the creation of backdoors for persistent access...
title: New Open SSH Vulnerability
